items.name: Ext.util.KeyMap
target
items.text: The object on which to listen for the event specified by the eventName config option.

items.name: binding
items.text:
Either a single object describing a handling function for s specified key (or set of keys), or
an array of such objects.

items.name: key
items.text:
A single keycode or an array of keycodes to handle, or a RegExp
which specifies characters to handle, eg `/[a-z]/`.

items.name: shift
items.text:
True to handle key only when shift is pressed, False to handle the
 key only when shift is not pressed (defaults to undefined)

items.name: ctrl
items.text:
True to handle key only when ctrl is pressed, False to handle the
 key only when ctrl is not pressed (defaults to undefined)

items.name: alt
items.text:
True to handle key only when alt is pressed, False to handle the key
 only when alt is not pressed (defaults to undefined)

items.name: handler
items.text: The function to call when KeyMap finds the expected key combination

items.name: fn
items.text: Alias of handler (for backwards-compatibility)

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope (`this` context) in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: defaultEventAction
items.text:
A default action to apply to the event *when the handler returns `true`*. Possible values
 are: stopEvent, stopPropagation, preventDefault. If no value is set no action is performed.

items.name: processEventScope
items.text: The scope (`this` context) in which the processEvent method is executed.

items.name: ignoreInputFields
items.text: Configure this as `true` if there are any input fields within the target, and this KeyNav should not process events from input fields, (`<input>, <textarea> and elements with `contentEditable="true"`)

items.name: priority
items.text:
The priority to set on this KeyMap's listener. Listeners with a higher priority are fired before those with
lower priority.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The event to listen for to pick up key events.

items.name: processEvent
items.text: An optional event processor function which accepts the argument list provided by the eventName of the target, and returns a keyEvent for processing by the KeyMap. This may be useful when the target is a Component with a complex event signature, where the event is not the first parameter. Extra information from the event arguments may be injected into the event for use by the handler functions before returning it. If null is returned the KeyMap stops processing the event.

items.name: legacyConstructor
items.text: Old constructor signature

items.name: el
items.text: The element or its ID, or Component to bind to

items.name: binding
items.text: The binding (see addBinding)

items.name: eventName
items.text: The event to bind to

items.name: addBinding
binding
items.text:
A single KeyMap config or an array of configs.
The following config object properties are supported:

items.name: key
items.text:
A single keycode or an array of keycodes to handle, or a RegExp
which specifies characters to handle, eg `/[a-z]/`.

items.name: shift
items.text:
True to handle key only when shift is pressed,
False to handle the keyonly when shift is not pressed (defaults to undefined).

items.name: ctrl
items.text:
True to handle key only when ctrl is pressed,
False to handle the key only when ctrl is not pressed (defaults to undefined).

items.name: alt
items.text:
True to handle key only when alt is pressed,
False to handle the key only when alt is not pressed (defaults to undefined).

items.name: handler
items.text:
The function to call when KeyMap finds the
expected key combination.

items.name: fn
items.text: Alias of handler (for backwards-compatibility).

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope (`this` context) in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: defaultEventAction
items.text:
A default action to apply to the event *when the handler returns `true`*.
Possible values are: stopEvent, stopPropagation, preventDefault. If no value is
set no action is performed..

items.name: removeBinding
items.text: Remove a binding from this KeyMap.

items.name: binding
items.text: See addBinding

items.name: handleTargetEvent
items.text: Process the eventName from the target.

items.name: processBinding
items.text: Process a particular binding and fire the handler if necessary.

items.name: binding
items.text: The binding information

items.name: checkModifiers
items.text: Check if the modifiers on the event match those on the binding
True if the event matches the binding

items.name: on
items.text: Shorthand for adding a single key listener.

items.name: key
items.text:
Either the numeric key code, array of key codes or an object with the
following options: `{key: (number or array), shift: (true/false), ctrl: (true/false), alt: (true/false)}`

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to call

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the function is executed.
Defaults to the browser window.

items.name: un
items.text: Shorthand for removing a single key listener.

items.name: key
items.text:
Either the numeric key code, array of key codes or an object with the
following options: `{key: (number or array), shift: (true/false), ctrl: (true/false), alt: (true/false)}`

items.name: fn
items.text: The function to call

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the function is executed.
Defaults to the browser window.

items.name: isEnabled
items.text: Returns true if this KeyMap is enabled

items.name: enable
items.text: Enables this KeyMap

items.name: disable
items.text: Disable this KeyMap

items.name: setDisabled
items.text: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

items.name: destroy
items.text: Destroys the KeyMap instance and removes all handlers.

items.name: removeTarget
items.text: True to also remove the target

items.name: lastKeyEvent
items.text: The last key event that this KeyMap handled.
